text:
hotel yg sangat strategis di tengah kota. vibe nya bangunan lama tp tidak spooky sama sekali. suka dengan vibe bangunannya. 

kamarnya bersih dan nyaman. dapat upgrade dari deluxe ke premier (with bathtub + balcony) 

cons nya :
- waktu parkir agak membingungkan karena tidak ada satpam yg membantu atur / arahkan parkir. apalagi waktu saya menginap spt nya mau ada acara bukber jadi agak ramai. dan parkiran cm ada outdoor saja
- jalan ke kamar juga agak membingungkan arahnya. tapi begitu tny staff langsung dibantu antar ke kamar
- waktu kesini , kolam sedang ditutup dan taman depan juga direnovasi :(((

semoga next time bisa menginap di shalimar lagi ! thankyou shalimar
title: hotel strategis di malang

text:

text:
The Shalimar Boutique  Hotel adalah salah satu hotel bintang 5 di kota malang, yang terletak di Kl. Cerme no.16, oro-oro dowo.  
The Shalimar Boutique Hotel  berkonsep  arsitektur kolonial yang megah di tahun 1930-an. 
Bangunannya sendiri merupakan salah satu cagar budaya.  

Hotel ini memiliki 44 kamar tamu, kolam renang, juga meeting room, serta fasilitas lainnya.

Untuk konsep interior didalam hotel ini sangat unik dan mewah, terdapat banyak koleksi barang- tempo doeloe..😁. Dan tidak lupa banyak sport photo yg menarik.  Bagi yang ini berbelanja hotel ini jg memiliki Boutique sendiri.
Hotelnya sangat bersih dan Asri.

Selama bulan Ramadhan The Shalimar Boutique menyiapkan menu paket  Bukber  yaitu "Sego KROYOKAN" yang terdiri dari dua macam The Hemel Ngalam dan The Hemel Gadang.  Menu perpaketnya  275K utk sekitar 5-6 org dan 149K utk 2 org. 
Untuk rasanya sangat memanjakan lidah 🥰, semua masakannya enak.. rekomended banget.👍👍👍 yummy.

Satu lagi yang sangat berkesan kamar mandi umumnya sangat unikk dan mewah...😍🤩
title: Bukber

owner_response.text:
Dear, Budi Hartono L

Salam hangat dari kami, The Shalimar Boutique Hotel. 
Terima kasih atas waktu yang sudah Ibu luangkan untuk berbagi review mengenai hotel kami. 

Merupakan suatu kebanggaan dan kehormatan tersendiri bagi kami mendengar pengalaman ibu/bapak di hotel kami yang begitu mengesankan dan nyaman. Selain fasilitas hotel kami yang lengkap dan mewah, kamar yang luas dan keramahan staff kami, merupakan tujuan kami untuk melestarikan bangunan sejarah dengan tidak mengubah bangunan asli tetapi tetap dapat dinikmati oleh semua usia dengan gaya modern vintage colonial heritage yang unik. 
Review yang positif ini menjadi semangat kami untuk tetap berusaha memberikan layanan yang maksimal serta tetap terus berupaya untuk menjaga kelestarian sejarah Indonesia. 

Sekali lagi kami ucapkan terimakasih dan kami berharap bisa dapat berjumpa kembali bersama ibu/bapak di kesempatan mendatang. 


Salam Hangat, 
The Shalimar Boutique Hotel Malang

owner_response.text:
Dear Mr. Jaya B, 

Salam hangat dari the Shalimar Boutique Hotel Malang

Terima kasih telah memilih menginap bersama the Shalimar Boutique Hotel dan memberikan waktu Bapak yang berharga untuk berbagi pengalaman Bapak selama di hotel kami.  

Kami sangat senang mendengar bahwa Bapak sangat menikmati waktu menginap bersama kami terutama dengan kamar kami yang bersih, pelayanan kami yang ramah dan keberadaan taman di depan hotel kami.  Kami berusaha selalu untuk menjaga keaslian dan kelestarian baik bangunan dan taman agar para tamu dapat merasakan pengalaman yang berbeda dan autentik pada saat menginap bersama kami. 

Kami memohon maaf atas ketidakpuasan bapak mengenai sarapan pagi kami, kami akan terus melakukan peningkatan sarapan pagi kami sehingga lebih bervariatif dengan rasa yang sesuai dengan standard kami yang sesungguhnya.  

Sekali lagi terima kasih atas masukan positif Bapak, hal ini akan menjadi motivasi bagi kami untuk terus berkembang dan meningkatkan pelayanan kami untuk yang akan datang. Kami menunggu kedatangan Bapak kembali di the Shalimar Boutique Hotel.  

Salam hangat,
Keluarga the Shalimar Boutique Hotel Malang

owner_response.text:
Dear Deya D,

Salam hangat dari the Shalimar Boutique Hotel di Malang, 

Pertama-tama kami ucapkan terima kasih telah meluangkan waktu untuk menuliskan ulasan mengenai pengalaman ibu di the Shalimar Boutique Hotel. 
Kami sangat senang mengetahui ulasan positif ibu mengenai pelayanan staff kami yang ramah dan kamar yang sesuai dengan harapan serta telah menikmati nasi goreng dan mie goreng kami yang lezat di restaurant De Hemel.  Kepuasan ibu merupakan hal yang sangat penting bagi kami.

Kami mohon maaf atas ketidaknyamanan yang ibu alami mengenai drainage dan kulkas kami yang tidak sesuai dengan harapan ibu. Kami akan menindaklanjuti hal ini segera.  

Sekali lagi kami ucapkan terima kasih atas ulasan ibu dan kami sangat terhormat telah menjadi salah satu boutique hotel terbaik yang pernah ibu singgahi.  
Kami tidak sabar menyambut kedatangan ibu berikutnya.  

Salam hangat, 
Keluarga the Shalimar Boutique Hotel Malang

text:
Secara umum saya merasakan jika hotel ini masih berpotensi untuk memberikan pelayanan yang lebih maksimum kepada para tamunya. Bangunan cantik dan taman yang dimiliki tidak bisa dinikmati oleh semua tamu dengan maksimal. Suasana di sekitar kolam renang sangat cantik, namun harus berhati-hati dengan nyamuk-nyamuk.

Para staf sangat ramah kepada para tamu. Seragam yang dikenakan untuk unik dan cantik, serasa kembali ke jaman kolonial ;p

Variasi menu untuk sarapan masih kurang, dan konsistensi kualitas rasa makanan masih kurang. Hari pertama rasa makanan masih belum maksimal dan cukup jauh dari harapan, hari kedu rasa makanan lebih enak dan pada hari ketiga rasa serta variasi makanan sangat baik. 

Fasilitas di kamar cukup lengkap, akses internet agak lamban, dan banyak perlengkapan di dalam kamar mandi yang rusak, termasuk pintu kamar mandi yang tidak bisa menutup rapat. Ada beberapa kamar yang menurut saya kurang cocok untuk diberikan kepada tamu, misalnya kamar 204 yang berlokasi di lantai 2 diujung blok bagian utara. Dengan tangga berputar dan sempit, sangat tidak direkomendasikan untuk keluarga dengan anak kecil. Kamar terkesan gelap dan interiornya menunurut saya tidak jelas konsepnya (sangat berbeda dengan foto yang saya lihat di trip advisor). 

Dan lantai satu juga terdapat kamar dengan jendela yang berhadapan dengan dinding putih (tanpa hiasan tanaman apapun) berjarak kurang lebih satu meter. Untuk tamu yang ingin menikmati suasana kota malang dari kamarnya harus benar-benar menekankan kepada front office agar diberi kamar yang nyaman.
title: hotel yang masih berpotensi untuk bagus

text: Ini merupakan hotel yang bagus, dan tidak jauh dari pusat kota Malang. Kamarnya besar, Kamar mandinya luas, semuanya didekorasi dengan cantik dan mempunyai perlengkapan yang bagus. Kolam renangnya indah untuk dilihat (begitu juga untuk berenang didalamnya)dan disana juga terdapat bar kolam renang/teras area. Staf restorannya sangat baik, dan makanannya juga lumayan enak. Staf tidak bisa lebih membantu lagi, terutama saat kami berusaha untuk melakukan transfer yang ambisius pada hari liburan umum mereka - Mereka benar-benar melayani pelanggan dengan sangat baik. Dan saya mengunakan pelayanan massage dalam kamar yang sangat murah dan terbaik yang saya pernah dapat di Indonesia-sangat saya rekomendasikan.

Istri saya dan saya menghabiskan beberapa malam di hotel Graha Cakra diawal bulan Agustus dan kami sangat menyukainya. Furniturenya sangat antik dan dibuat dari ukiran kayu atau batu tradisional Indonesia. Kamar suite kami lumayan besar, sama dengan ruang luarnya dan semua bagian dari hotel ini, sangat bersih, terpelihara dengan baik, toiletnya luas, namun untuk showernya tidak sesuai dengan keseluruhan hal terdapat dihotel ini. 

Disana terdapat kolam renang dan kebun yang cantik dengan beberapa bunga cantik menghiasinya. Sarapannya oke, prasmanan hidangan lokal maupun internasional, disana terdapat sambungan internet wifi gratis, namun hanya terjangkau di lobby dan restoran. 

Saya akan merekomendasi hotel ini untuk kesemua wisatawan.

text:
If you treasure the elegant charm of the great old world of classic taste, then The Shalimar exudes this to its core. Despite its location in Malang and the ornate Javanese wooden door carving at the entrance, the exquisite beauty and comfort of The Shalimar is quite universal. I was transported to an era of days gone by, where time stood still and service was prime. 
The Shalimar isn’t expansive but every nook and corner where our eyes could see is spared no expense, dressed opulently articulating a design that blends classic with modern convenience. From the tucked away reception to the floating bar and baby grand piano in the Hemmet restaurant with its intricately delicate chandelier...all is good in The Shalimar.
title: Old world elegance at its best

text:
This is a great comfortable hotel, but the staff is lacking training in attention to detail. Which is the definition of a boutique hotel. 
English is key for a front desk employee and we have to say not all the ladies there were up to speed to help us.
We were rather disappointed when we arrived and they didn't seem to have our pre-arranged tours booked. To this day we cannot tell if it was a communication issue due to their English level or if they truly didn't registered our emailed months old reservations.
In any case it all worked out well, we did our Mount Bromo tour and the waterfalls, tea plantation and temples around Batu.
Food was really good at breakfast and the pool was a blessing after long days outside.
The boutique was always closed when we were there, so we couldn't buy some of the amazing clothes they had in display. 
There is no afternoon tea for that we recommend Tugu Hotel, it was amazing. Although given the not so centric location of The Shalimar you will have to take a taxi, because walking in the area is not easy as there are no side walks or crossings.
Beware that the hotel is not easy to find, even by taxi drivers so you better precharge the location in your phone to indicate where they have to turn right and then immediately left  in Cerme street if coming from the train station.
title: Great architecture, but attention to detail is not their forte

text:
An amazingly beautiful hotel located right in front of a super charming nice little park (Taman Cerme), The original building was 85 years old, and the management did a fantastic job in building a classy boutique hotel from this historical property.

All the small touches in the property oozes class: the decor, the choice of material, the ambiance. You would usually find this kind of establishment in Jakarta (capital city), so to find Shalimar in the quaint charming little town of Malang was definitely a super nice surprise.

The only improvement we could suggest is the bathroom which is still utilizing older bath tubs with showers. When the management did major renovations to the rooms several years back, they should have made the bathrooms a bit more modern.

Nonetheless, this hotel remains a top notch selection and I cant recommend it more.
title: Amazingly beautiful hotel

text:
As usual, my wife picked the hotel for us, amd this time she picked The Shalimar Boutique Hotel for our 2-nights stay in Malang.

The hotel is nicely located in the upper-class residential area in Malang. However, the premise blends the neighbourhood beautifully as the hotel was set up and designed more into a big house. Thus, it creates homey atmosphere for its guests.

The check in process was smooth, and the room was prepared in advance. The gentleman in the front desk was genuinely polite and warm when he offered a breakfast box and taxi for me for the next day, as I had to leave the hotel early to catch an event. (Too bad, a miscommunication seems happened that the breakfast box and the taxi were never there, and the night-shift duty officer convinced me that his colleague never put that request in their book. However he offered me to serve quick breakfast, eventhough that I left 15 minutes later than plan).

The food is good.

The room is sufficiently spacious with basic amenities.
Minibar fridge contains nothing, however the hotel provides complimentary local snack and delicacies.
title: Unique Set Up

text:
We stayed there for 2 nights, and we pretty enjoy our time staying there. The Staffs were very friendly and helpful, the building is pretty new with the colonial touch, which is very beautiful and comfy. Food is very enjoyable and delicious, very nice taste indeed, our compliment for the chef.

Critics? Yes, we got a room beside the crowded road beside the hotel, and its very noisy, it would be very helpful if the hotel improve their soundproof structure in their rooms. We realize it, because you would hear "the activities" and conversations in every rooms we passed by down the aisle. So, careful, your privacy is not really private, because the lack of soundproof from the room.

Overall, I give a good grade, because I believe they have room of improvement, if you ask me where would you stay in Malang? I will definitely recommend this Hotel :)

text:
This is a very cozy small boutique hotel. It is historical and has a colonial feel to it. Rooms are good appointed and have a great design, although the bathrooms are fairly small and have no tubs. But the shower area is spacious enough. Breakfast selection is not that great but enough I guess and I can see they put effort. Food was okay. 

I was greatly surprised by the whole design of the hotel and the room. The amenities are neatly packed like they do in big luxurious hotels, small details are not overlooked and cleanliness is very good. I love the whole ambience of the hotel and definitely a hidden gem in the middle of Malang. 

A bit question mark on their concierge service though. I asked them to call for a taxi to take me to the airport but the front desk said taxis would arrive late and some other excuses, and they were trying to get me to use the hotel shuttle service instead. It cost 300,000 for their bigger car as opposed to only 65,000 using taxi. Not rebuffed by their argument, I called the taxi myself and it arrived even earlier than scheduled time. It cost only 65,000! 

Another thing is that my daughter wanted to have the access card for her collection but they wouldnt give it to her, they were gonna charge me 70,000 for it. So I didn't get it. They need to work on stuff like this. Rejection to customers is never good.

Overall, I would come back to this hotel when visiting Malang again.
title: Nice but needs extra touch on service

text:
This hotel is very artistic. The architecture is colonial style, the reception and the staff also dressed with the same theme. The room is immaculate, in terms of cleanliness, room temperature, bed coziness, turn-down services, bathroom utilities, TV, balcony. They are all perfect. 
The Shalimar also has a very cozy library / reading room, where you can find books about art, design, history, etc. The breakfast is very nice, but the variety is not at the smorgasbord level that I had imagine. However, you could request, and they get it for you. 
The swimming pool is outdoor one, equipped with a small gym.
The hotel is also nicely located at the heart of Malang, but away from the traffic jam. Because the roads nearby are all the wider ones.
Overall, a very memorable stay in an excellent hotel, with 5-star service.
Highly recommended.

text: We had a family holiday last Dec-2017. Total 9 of us stayed in this magnificent hotel. We ordered 3 rooms. Cant recall what type of the rooms. The decoration is awesome! Each rooms is decorated with Sketch by famous Dutch artist "John Van Der Sterren". It amazed me. So far only this hotel , from so many hotels I stayed , really displayed a real art-work of a famous artist inside the rooms. If you are an art-lover, you will love to stay in this state-of-art rooms. The dining table for breakfast also awesome. We ordered a scrabble egg, and it was served like a fine dining style. Good breakfast ambience , believe will be even nicer if you had a dinner there. They also has library, really nice. but I don't have a time to visit there. Most of our times are spent outside hotels. Didn't have chance also to try the swimming pools. But it looks great. Feels like your own private villa swimming pools. The rooms are nice for couples, and if you are planning for a honeymoon for couples, would recommended for this place. We love all the hotels decoration. Love the front office desk. It doesn't feel like you are check-in on a hotel. The Bed also very comfy. I don't feel a backpain after I wake up. Most hotel I stayed, I can feel backpain. I believe the bed is really made from a high quality matrass. Not too soft but not too hard. Just nice for my back. Really love it!
title: NICE PLACE and MEMORABLE!!!

Ita Kristiana

text:
I always love a nostalgic hotel with rich history like Shalimar. You can really feel the Dutch Colonial atmosphere from the entrance, lobby and the restaurant. I love the interior and the beautifully framed old photos hanged on the white walls.  

The corridors and the rooms are very modern, minimalistic, and clean. Modern and comfortable but lacking the colonial theme and mood. Once you are inside the room you feel like in regular nice modern hotel. 

Service was excellent. Every single staff we met shown extraordinary hospitality and high level of service.

Our rooms was facing the big street and we could hear the noise from the traffic very loudly in the evening.  A better soundproofing on the windows would be magnificent.

Overall we enjoy the stay and the service of this majestic boutique hotel.
title: Colonial Architecture, Modern Comfort, & Javanese Hospitality

text:
It is really nice hotel, very charming, elegant and very clean
Before it was graha cakra hotel, now after newly renovated this hotel become an amazing hotel and impressive hotel

Location is in the city centre, there are some restaurant and cafe nearby.
A cross of the hotel has a beautiful little park.

Staff was very helpful and friendly with big smile

I was stay in executive room 112 and then I moved to 219. 
My first room, I was very impress, big and very clean. Bed very comfort and really elegant, but the bathroom was very small compare with the room size. No bathtub, only shower. Air shower is weak.
Hot water is confusing, sometime hot, sometime cold

My second room 219, they said this is the best room for executive room type, yes it is...
Compare with 112, this room is bigger and nice arrangement 
But it is not soundproof, we can still hear very clearly the sound from outside, especially the sound of motorcycles 
The bathroom is bigger and has bathtub, but when we take shower, the floor will be flooded because they put the output on the wrong side. Air pressure is also not good. Hot and cold water were also very confusing.

Wifi is adequate, not fast and not slow

my suggestion, I think the manager or the owner should try to stay in each room to know how it feel and  what is the problem of each room.

It was raining when we arrived at the hotel, to go to our room 112 from the lobby, we must pass to the alley.. Between library and the restaurant. It was open top alley, so we will get wet when it is a raining day.
My suggestion, you could close the top with a glass so you can still get the sun light

The restaurant has very nice decor, Breakfast, they don't serve buffet breakfast, they serve breakfast menu, the taste was average

Menu is little bit pricy, not worth it with the taste and appearance of food as a 5 stars hotel

Actually it was a pleasant stay, but they need more improvement on the food and recheck on detail of each room
title: The Best boutique hotel in Malang

owner_response.text:
Dear Tantolau, 

Warmest greetings from the Shalimar, 

On behalf of staff and management at the Shalimar Boutique Hotel, we thank you for your visit to our hotel and We also would like to extend our appreciation and thanks for your time in sharing your feedback in details in order for us to continually improve our service.  

We are very delighted to hear that you had a pleasant stay and our staff was very helpful and friendly.  
Our location is very strategic in a luxurious residential area where restaurants, cafes and supermarkets are nearby making  it the perfect choice to stay when in Malang.  Moreover, our guests can enjoy the labyrinth garden/park with a giant gramophone adjacent to the hotel.  

We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay at the Shalimar which are not up to our standards.  
Please be advised since your visit and based on your feedback, the bathtub design has been fixed so the water no longer overflows.  The hot water’s temperature and pressure is now stable.  
In regards to the breakfast we now serve buffet breakfast to cater for our guests.  

We are currently working together with our interior designer to provide a cover or shade for our open air corridor/alley.

Thank you very much once again for your time in sharing your constructive feedback, it truly motivates us to strive for excellence.

Looking forward to serving you again.

Warm regards, 
Ita Kristiana and the Shalimar Boutique Hotel Malang

The ambience is definitely from the past, with the staff extremely helpful, always pleasant and making it a pleasure to stay in the hotel.
The rooms are clean and serviced quickly and can't be complained about other than that there is traffic noise in the morning rush hour-but we soon got used to it.
Dining room breakfast buffet is good and the  lunch and dinner menu is good value for money and wide-ranging and  hard to fault.
Would return anytime and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

text:
Stayed here for one night only but it was a great night rest! Beautiful room, nicely decorated hotel in the middle of the ancient colonial neighborhood. Surprising to hear the gramma phone in the middle of the parc playing Dutch music. Nice touch. Breakfast was good, fresh and quit when we were there.
A few little things could be improved as it is rated as a 5 star hotel. When coming ‘ home ‘ I expect to be greeted by the front office member but instead the 2 members of staff were obviously more occupied with their cellphone. No heads came up to great us. 
In the bathroom three little things. The black stone to put the soap on is impossible to have the soap bar stay on it...... it slides if every time. Maybe a different kind of thing to put the soap on?Also when taking a shower the water gets on the side of the bath and eventually flooded on the floor. Also the glass wall to protect the rest of the bathroom could be a bit longer perhaps. 
In the public area some lamps were not working or the ‘ lampenkap’  not straight ( restaurant room) . All minor things but in a five star hotel one may expect that also the details are correct.

Nevertheless we had a good time, always too short.... but I would recommend The Shalimar without any doubt.
title: Comfy beds for a good night rest.

text:
The location is pretty strategic, it's in Ijen area and surrounded by lots of food places.
The hotel is typically boutique-hotel, not too big, but can provide warm atmosphere.
The staffs are superb; from the security officers-concierge-receptionist-waiter/waitress-supervisor; they're all nice.
The inner side of the building isn't really indoor, lots of open space, but somehow it's free from flies, just a few mosquitoes in certain areas.
The room is nice, not really big, but not that petite. Some stains on the bedsheet and towels, and I think they need to renew the carpet; but the overall cleanliness is good. One downside will be the room's door that's not sound-proof. We stayed in a room that is facing to the street and we were a bit disturbed with the vehicles' sounds that passed by. Not to mention the front room door, we could also hear our neighbor's quarrels late at night.
The food? The variety is standard, but the taste is excellent. Thumbs up!
The swimming pool was shockingly dirty, even my lil boy got some rash after swimming.
Last but not least, this hotel is super pretty and chic, it has lots of cute spots for taking good pictures.

Summing all up, we were satisfied customers.

Wanna be back? We'd love to, just wish they've upgraded into perfection. :)

It’s a nice memory when I remember Graha Cakra, my husband and I were there  with my beloved Dad and Mom  about five years ago, hope this Indonesia-Colonial style hotel  is still as beautiful  as we stayed there, although so many good hotels in Malang nowadays.

I love the old building with good renovation without changing to much the original design, well related exterior and interior, thematic costume of the friendly-hotel staffs.  We chose rooms next to swimming pool and courtyard that was relaxing enough, especially for my parents so they don’t need to take the stair while staying there and enjoying the facilities. 

Another benefit of this hotel is location; it’s located at a good neighborhood that full of Dutch or Art Deco style, close to the park and a clean-traditional market “Pasar Oro-Oro Dowo” where we could find so many delicious-legendary traditional foods.  My Dad spent his high school at Malang, that trip was successfully bringing him pieces of nostalgia.

Malang is one of cozy destinations in Indonesia, and when you get there do choose the hotel wisely to enjoy your holiday ;)

text:
It had been a while since my last visit to the city and the receptionist still remembered my name and greeted me with smile, and allowed me for a very early (6 am) check in with no extra charge.
I used to stay at the deluxe room, but this time was booked at the superior room. The room is still alright but need renovation. The bathroom (shower only) is also small. Hot water is not reliable. the CRT TV is old. Not enough electrical power socket which is a necessity today. There is only one located behind a small table, and it's hard to reach. The superior rooms are located at the back of the building adjacent to the restaurant. Paying extra USD 20 for the deluxe room is well worth it.

The restaurant has nice decor (as with the lobby and the deluxe rooms). The food selection is limited. The breakfast buffet selection should be improved. I ordered Rijstafel (Indonesian's rice with a selection of small dishes) for lunch. It costed USD 5 ++. It's cheap and tasted good.

The hotel is located in a quiet area. A very nica small park is located right across the street. Behind the hotel, there is a large avenue, which is perfect for morning walk / job or afternoon stroll to admire the well-preserved, old dutch colonial houses. There are several coffee shops and restaurants nearby. 

What I like most: the service and the staff. They are great!!!  The interior decor of the lobby with a nice jasmine and pandan (Asian sweet grass) aroma, and the deluxe room. The location.

What I like least: most everything about the superior room needs to be upgraded. The selection of breakfast menu. There is no internet connection in the room, only in lobby and restaurant. The swimming pool in very small, no gym.

text:
Went back to my hometown of Malang after 19 years and made the decision to base myself at Graha Cakra.

They're selling themselves as a 'traditional hotel', from the old days of colonial Malang, and you can definitely see the history in all corners of the hotel.

From the vintage becak and Mercedes parked up front, the BMW motorcycles on the way in to the lobby, and all the woodcarvings and trinkets peppered all around the place they've really created a nice atmosphere from the old Dutch colonial days.

The small pool is also lovely for just lounging around, as are the weekend live music performances.

Room itself is fine, with more traditional furnishings. Clean standing shower was also sufficient.

However I agree with some of the posters here in saying that the hotel building itself can use a little refresher, as some of the paintjobs and woodworks are falling apart.

If you're looking for something different from the usual contemporary-style hotel (and your budget is below Tugu Hotel), then I would definitely recommend this place.
title: Quaint little hotel that need refreshing

In general this hotel deserves two thumbs up, and highly recommended.

text:
The Graha Cakra Malang, is what I would call "Indonesian 4 star"
An old Dutch building in what seems to be a "better" part of Malang.
The surrounding, well kept, larger homes, in the surrounding suburb, seemed to be owned by Doctors, and those in the Finance Industry.
250 metres away on Jl Iljen are the mansions of Malang.
The staff at the hotel, were just fantastic, looking out for our needs.
They were very observant, and noticed that one of our party, were having a birthday, and they brought a "crepe and candle" to our breakfast table, on that day and sang Happy Birthday.
While waiting for our driver, for our trip to Mt Bromo @ 1am in the morning, I mentioned to a staff member, that I wanted to source a special souvenir from Malang.
(Some old local Indonesian Car number plates)
I was told that that would not be possible.
Anyway, on leaving the Graha Cakra, we were presented with some somewhat personalised, genuine Indonesian Car number plates, that that staff member from the 1am shift, had specially sourced or manufactured.
A really touching thought on behalf of that staff member, and a genuine reflection, on our view of the staff, there is that they went out of their way to please.
Breakfast at Graha Cakra, was nice, if somewhat basic, more geared to Indonesian and Asian tastes, though I must say, I was impressed with there attempt, to find Worcestershire sauce, for my eggs. They found some "English Sauce", a Chinese made sweeter, but not quite right equivalent.
The Indonesian and Japanese breakfasts were nice.
The bathroom area, of the rooms were a little on the small side, but as I say this is what i call Indonesian 4 star.

There are nice restaurants nearby (just across the road), that have bands playing at night.
The D-Pav  and Teysa's.
Indonesian meals from IDR 20,000 (USD2) to IDR 60,000 (USD6) or so.

We caught the Local Angkot IDR2500 (25 cents) per trip to get to the old town centre (Alun Alun) or to the shopping mall (Matos)

Organised taxi from the Malang airport to Graha Cakra IDR 65,000 (USD6.50)

In April in Malang, it rained every day at 3pm to 4pm or so.

All in all, a great Indonesian experience holiday, the people at the Graha Cakra are great, the hotel rooms servicable, in a generally good area.

Mark Auzzie.
title: Graha Cakra, Malang, East Java.

text:
I visit Malang quite regularly with my family and we usually stay at The Graha Cakra Hotel as it is the best blend of value and ambience. 

The quality is very good (not excellent). If you want better quality try the Tugu Hotel.
However - I would avoid any other hotels in Malang as they tend to be faceless hotels with no character. (Except for the Spendid Inn which has character but is very old and tired).

At the Graha Cakra - the staff are always friendly and try to make your stay as happy as possible.

The hotel is located in an old dutch style building, the bell boys use an old style uniform, and there are a number of older "museum" pieces around the hotel that keep the colonial style theme.

The rooms are a bit old style themselves - but they are clean and comfortable enough.
The tv is small and the channels are limited.
Wifi is in the common areas and is ok.

The hotel is located in a quiet leafy up market suburb adjacent to the main city area. To get to the centre of town - we always take a becak which takes 5-10 minutes (a becak is a type of bicycle transport) and there are always becak drivers outside the hotel.

There is a small pool at the hotel which is pleasant and has sunbathing lounges.

There is a small park outside the hotel which is quite pretty.
There are a few convenience shops and internet cafes within about 200 metres of the hotel.

There is one restaurant which serves very good quality Indonesian food. The western food they serve is good - but we tend to stick to the Indonesian dishes as they are better quality.

Breakfast buffet is basic - but sufficient.

We often stay here before catching an early flight from Surabaya airport - and the hotel organises high quality car transport complete with a driver and packed breakfast.

I would recommend this hotel for people who are looking for a friendly hotel at a value price.
If you want a better quality hotel - I would recommend the Tugu hotel - but you will need to pay nearly twice the price.
title: Great Value for Money - Friendly Ambience

text:
i went to graha cakra on a 2 nights business trip  ..  and i find the hotel is very comforting, quite good food, relaxing, not too small ibut quite private. Most of the guest are foreign tourist who travel around malang, bromo, and surabaya. 
the hotel is located in the ijen area in malang city..an area that reminds me of Menteng in Jakarta coz of the big trees, old big colonial houses but in a beautiful ways..
you can find public transport just in the corner near the hotel or you can go by "becak"..a traditional local transport ..
there;s a vintage old car in the front of the hotel..i guest that car is sort of the icon of the hotel..and also becak...you can take pictures with it :)
and if you are planning to see the Malang Tempo Doeloe festival around the ijen area...this hotel is the perfect place to stay..coz you can walk to the main road where the festival are held. and you can find many old interesting things from the java culture to the dutch culture influence..
this hotel is perfect for people who don't really like a big crowded hotel..it's just a simple modest and clean comforting hotel with past colonial atmosphere..well it's perfect for me :)
title: nice location, relaxing colonial atmosphere

text: This was my second visit, this time with friends.  In the meantime I had heard about at least one other apparently good hotel in Malang (which I visited during my visit).  But this was the right call, again.  The Graha Cakra is a beautiful, understated, elegant, well-maintained art deco hotel with impeccable service, and at a reasonable price.  It is in a good location, a  quiet, mainly residential area of the Dutch colonial era.  It is not far from the central areas of the city, and from the northern areas of interest (Candi Batut and some interesting shopping areas).  The restaurant is good with a varied menu at good prices.  On some evenings there is entertainment as well.  I will definitely go back there. (Note:  the pool area is being renovated but you can still swim in the pristine pool after 4 pm most days although there is not a lot of seating around it)
title: Best place to stay in Malang

text:
A friend and I came to Malang thinking we'd spend a couple days but we quickly decided to extend to six nights after arriving at the Graha Cakra. We love it here! The biggest draw is the impeccable, friendly service. They truly make you feel at home here. I don't agree with a previous comment on the standard rooms being small - the standard room has been great for us.  It's super neat and clean. The bathrooms, while not as big as Westerners will be used to, is still much better than any we've seen in Indonesia. The restaurant is also incredible, and we found the breakfasts to be on par or better with many big Western chains. We are really enjoying mornings at the beautiful pool as well. My only criticism is that there is no fitness center, but fortunately the area is quite tame relative to other hotels here and it's possible to find nice places to go for runs around the hotel.
Of course, the big competition is Hotel Tugu which is nearly double the price. We've been there a couple times, and think we made the better decision. For the price, you simply can't beat the amazing accommodations and service at Cakra. Treat yourself to dinner at Tugu, but stay at Cakra.
title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Malang

text: We stayed for 2 days in August 2011 with a 9 year old also. I enjoyed the charm of the hotel and that it was not too big. Our bathroom was good and the water was hot and good pressure. You may have also been able to drink the water from the tap, but I cannot remember for sure. (This is not often possible in Indonesia). Room was plenty large, although I don't know what type of room we had. It was on 2nd level with small balcony looking to the front. The breakfast buffet was ok and the swimming pool nice and used by us a few times. No internet in room but free internet by the pool and in the restaurant. No problem for speed with remote connection to my office in USA. AC was good with no problems, although it is cooler in Malang (mountain area) than many cities in Indonesia. This hotel was actually our 2nd choice, recommended by my Indonesian friend, because the other hotel was full. Rate was acceptable and the staff was very nice. . Everyone was nice to my little girl, which is always a huge deal to me. The layout feels very open with the rooms located on partly open corridors, and a small area close with the corridors for check-in. Some European back pack tourists were complaining cuz the hotel was full and no rooms, so maybe should book early! I thought it was funny. I had tried to post photos in the past but trip advisor crashed when sending them. We would have stayed longer, but moved to my friends house. I would be happy to stay there again.
title: Pleasant 2 day stay

text:
The Graha Cakra is a good hotel and in a very convenient location near the center of Malang.  In the very early morning, walks around the neighborhood can be pleasant.

The greenery on the grounds of the hotel is quite relaxing and the pool is good for a quick swim, a few laps, and its sufficient for the kids to play in for several hours.  Sitting areas around the pool are pleasant.

The rooms are clean overall but we had trouble with the AC units in both rooms we stayed in.  The AC's appeared dirty and quite moldy.  Two family members had problems with allergies because of the condition of the AC units.  The AC temperature was unchangeable and at times it seemed set a bit warm.

The staff was friendly and helpful though a bit distant and reserved.  They were helpful in assisting several small needs we had during our stay.

One of the odd things was the music in the hallways which we heard through the night.  I can understand music perhaps in the daytime, but it was annoying to still hear it at 3 am.

The the main dining room is decorated nicely, we were disappointed with the breakfast...very greasy.  Certainly not a low calorie or low-fat breakfast.  We also doubt the cleanliness of the food and food service.  We cringed as one of the food servers (very obviously ill) sneezed and coughed and continued to serve food without washing his hands.  Some of the food serving equipment appeared quite dirty and not hygienic.   

Overall, service and food was ok but not as good as you would find in a similarly priced hotel in Jakarta or Bali.  Training seems to need to be improved at this hotel.  We know that service and food would be better at a similarly priced hotel, the Santika Malang  (though the location of the Santika isn't quite as central).

We would return to the hotel in the future, but we'd probably be a bit careful of the food and seeker to find a lower price for this hotel than what we paid.

The wireless internet connect in the lobby was adequate but not great.
title: Very nice but needs improvement in key areas

text:
We chose Graha Cakra over Hotel Tugu simply because one of my travel companions was not feeling comfortable with Hotel Tugu's Javanese classic interior (she said the antiques and old paintings creeps her out), which I personally thought was very interesting. So, Graha Cakra’s modern with Javanese touch interior that won our heart. It is located near by Malang’s rich area of Jalan Ijen with easy access, although finding local rickshaw was rather a challenge, but then the receptionist helped us to call taxi service that took less than 5 minutes to arrive.

Similar with comment from coolden bellow, we had a rather unpleasant experience with the receptionist. Two months prior to the trip, we booked 2 Deluxe rooms for 2 nights directly to the hotel. Since we’re coming in on a long weekend, which means most hotels would be fully booked, we asked whether we need to make down-payment to guarantee the room or not. She confirmed that such guarantee was not required to hold the room. So, we flew in from Jakarta to Malang, head directly to Bromo, and spent a night there. Early the next morning, we went for the sunrise over at Bromo without bringing my mobile phone. When I return to the room, I had several miss calls from an unknown Malang’s numbers and a text message saying that the hotel had to give-up our rooms since we didn’t make any confirmation whether we would be coming or not. I immediately called them back and confirmed that we still wanted the rooms. Unfortunately, they already sold the rooms for both nights, yet then the receptionist told me that they would check their availability and get back to me. About an hour latter, the receptionist called back and she was able to find one Deluxe room and one Superior room, which we agreed to take.

Aside from the reservation incident, we had a good time in this charming hotel. The hotel interior was nice and modern, but still rich with Javanese traditional touch. The rooms were clean with nice and friendly staffs. The breakfast buffet didn’t have that much selections, but it was compensated with the nice Javanese ambiance of the dining area that made you want to stay longer having morning chit chat over cups of coffee. 

Overall, our stay at Graha Cakra was pleasant and I recommend the place to anybody who’s planning to go to Malang. But I seriously do think that the receptionist and reservation staffs have get more training on customer service.
title: Modern Alternative from Hotel Tugu

text:
Ein echtes kleines Boutique Hotel in einem alten, sehr gepflegten, holländischem Kolonialbau.
Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral in einer netten Umgebung und es ist trotzdem ruhig.
Die Einrichtung der gesamten Anlage ist stilvoll und dem Kolonialstil entsprechend. Es gibt eine nette Bar mit schönem Außenbereich und einen Pool.
Die Zimmer sind ebenfalls schön eingerichtet, verfügen über einen kleinen Balkon und sind sauber.
Das Personal ist durchgängig überaus freundlich jedoch sehr schlecht ausgebildet sodass es aufgrund dessen und aufgrund von Sprachschwierigkeiten schonmal das ein oder andere Missverständnis geben kann.
W-LAN im gesamten Gebäude vorhanden.
title: Schönes kleines Boutique Hotel

text: Hermoso hotel en una de las zonas mas lindas de Malang. El hotel evoca a los años 50 con la decoración y música de fondo. El servicio impecable y siempre todo el personal muy atento. Apartado especial para el el Sr. Aldi quien realmente de preocupo de que nuestra estadía fuera excelente todo el tiempo, atendiendo a todas nuestras  necesidades, aconsejo los mejores lugares y excursiones con guías profesionales y económicos. La verdad que hace mucho tiempo que un host no demostraba verdadera preocupación por la estadía de un huésped. El desayuno y el restorant impecables tambien.

text:
Durante 2 noches nos alojamos en este hotel de estilo colonial. Situado en una zona muy tranquila de Malang, el personal es muy amable y siempre dispuesto a ayudar. Las zonas comunes son muy agradables. El salón comedor es amplio y ofrece buenas comidas. La piscina no es muy grande, pero cumple su función a la perfección.
La habitación era confortable, aunque necesitaba una renovación. El mobiliario, la televisión y el lavabo se veian antiguos. Creemos que el hotel está en fase de renovación, ya que otras habitaciones se veian más modernas. 
Lo mejor es el ambiente de tranquilidad que se respira. Todo el hotel está rodeado de un pequeño jardin muy bien cuidado.
title: Tranquilidad, confort y amabilidad

text:
L'hôtel en lui même n'est pas trop mal, la piscine est asse accueillante mais les chambres.....une vrai catastrophe!!
Chambres minuscule vieillotte avec des prises électriques non sécurisées et sombre au possible.
La salle de bain minuscule également, avec un miroir fendu en deux, pas de sèche cheveux, un état de propreté assez limite.
La cuisine pas top du tout, pas de possibilités d'avoir du vin.
title: Très décevant

text:
Aangekomen na een lange rit van ruim 12 uur uit Yogjakarta was het een verassing dat het zo'n mooi hotel is. Het ligt in een wat rustiger deel van Malang in de villa wijk. 
Mooi restaurant met bar en heerlijk zwembad. De kamers zijn ruim en modern ingericht met badkamer en stortdouche.
Een ruime keus bij het ontbijt met verschillende soorten croissants en een kok die op bestelling een omelet maakt.
De reis van Yogjakarta naar Malang in busje van 8 personen koste 230.000 rp. p.p. Je moet wel van een uitdaging houden en daf je onderweg nog vraagt mee moet nemen moet je op de koop toenemen.
Al met al heerlijk relaxed hotel, aanrader.
B & S
title: Fantastisch Hollands huis...

text: Quand on arrive sa présente bien, jolie hall, personnel agréable, en somme joli cadre. Mais en arrivant aux chambres grosse déception. La notre était toute petite pour deux, pas de place pour poser les bagages, la literie dure, la TV très vielle, et le pire la salle de bains, MINUSCULE, pas de place pour poser les affaire de toilette et à peine la place pour une personne dedans. La deuxième chambre que nous avions avait une grande estrade en hauteur, pas pratique du tout pour poser des valises et la vieille TV dessus, pas du tout pratique non plus pour la regarder, trop loin du lit pour voir quelque chose. Les chambres méritent un sérieux rafraichissement et surtout refaire les salles de bains.
title: Chambres minuscules

Il personale molto gentile e disponibile. Altamente consigliato

text:
Wir waren für 4 Nächte im Juli 2012 im Graha Cakra in Malang.
Gebucht haben wir es u.a. wegen des im Internet beworbenen, schönen Pools. Nach einer anstrengenden Vulkantour wollten wir dort entspannen.
ABER: Der Pool war auf Grund einer Baustelle seit Februar gesperrt! Keinerlei Hinweise auf Webseite oder per Mail.
Auf Nachfrage, ob man als Ausgleich vielleicht ein Essen oder kostenlose Minibar bekommt, hat das Personal nur gelacht.

Die Zimmer waren gut, sauber und schön eingerichtet. Hier gibt es nichts zu bemängeln.
Das Frühstück war abwechslungsreich (mehrere warme Gerichte, dazu Toast, Müsli, Ei, ...).

Mit Pool hätte es 5 Sterne gegeben, hätten wir vorher eine Info bekommen, wären es noch 4 gewesen.
Aber da der Pool so beworben wurde und nicht nutzbar war, ist das leider mangelhaft.
title: Zimmer gut, aber Pool nicht benutzbar

text:
Unser Zimmer der Kategorie Deluxe war angenehm geräumig und zurückhaltend geschmackvoll möbliert. Der kleine Balkon befand sich auf der Straßenseite und war durch eine Art Kreisverkehr um einen kleinen Park herum verhältnismäßig laut.
Freundliches, geschultes Personal tröstete uns über das leider nicht sehr abwechslungsreiche und kaum auf europäischen Geschmack eingehende Frühstücksbüffet hinweg.
Die einem sehr schönen Villenumfeld geschuldete "Außen"-Lage kann man problemlos mit einer eigentlich immer verfügbaren "Fahrradrikscha " in wenigen Minuten überwinden und die unzähligen kleinen Restaurants erreichen. 
Fazit: Wenn das Frühstück nicht die wichtigste Mahlzeit des Tages ist,  lässt das Graha Cakra in Malang wenige Wünsche offen.
title: Komfortabel, stilvoll aber leider etwas abgelegen
